Could you confirm whether or not you are using any language packs, or whether you have any custom locale settings?

On RH9:

bash-2.05b$ locale
LANG=C
LC_CTYPE="C"
LC_NUMERIC="C"
LC_TIME="C"
LC_COLLATE="C"
LC_MONETARY="C"
LC_MESSAGES="C"
LC_PAPER="C"
LC_NAME="C"

LC_ALL=C

Vsevolod, please provide your exact TPTP and Eclipse configurations (ie what versions) that you have installed.  

There was a similar problem reported in https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=147342 that went away when they moved to TPTP 4.2.1.  We cannot reproduce the problem here. Can you please try the latest TPTP 4.2.1 and Eclipse 3.2.1 drivers to see if you still have the problem?  You can download the latest TPTP 4.2.1 driver that is being tested right now from http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/drops/TPTP-4.2.1-200609071820B.html. At the bottom of that page are the required Eclipse drivers.  Thanks.
Despite the errors that are shown when the Agent Control View is refreshed,  does the functionality work with the entries in the tree that are displayed or can you not use the functionality at all?
eclipse 3.2, tptp 4.2.1. tptp is installed as an extension, see attached image for details.

I'm not an eclipse expert but in org.eclipse.hyades.statistical.ui.UIPlugin :
resourceBundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.eclipse.hyades.statistical.ui.UiPluginResources");
Maybe the UiPluginResources is a wrong string and should be org.eclipse.hyades.statistical.ui.messages

I manage to laucnh AgentControl by copying message.properties to UIPluginResources.properties in the statistical_ui.jar

In Response to Comment #6,

Please try upgrading Eclipse to 3.2.1. It seems the probelem does not exist when using Eclipse 3.2.1 and TPTP 4.2.1 as reported in bug #147342 comment #10

Since this problem has not been reproduced with an Eclipse 3.2.1 and TPTP 4.2.1 environment as of yet we'll defer the bugzilla to 4.3 and drop the severity to major. I believe there is a still a code problem related to the resource bundle that needs to be addressed. If the problem can subsequently be reproduced in a 3.2.1/4.2.1 environment then we'll address it in the next 4.2 fix release.
